name: mosaic goldfish
notes:
free version available as video tutorial on my blog: https://www.sweetsofties.com/2023/05/mosaic-goldfish.html (free version shows 1 of the 4 fish scale designs. for all 4 fish scale designs, please download the written pdf pattern.)

the mosaic goldfish is a fast and no-sew amigurumi project that includes 4 different scale designs, allowing you to crochet a variety of fish.  more customizations can be done by using different yarn color combinations, yarn weights, and yarn fibers.  stitches featured in creating the fish scales include the use of drop stitches, puff stitches, and working in back loops only.
this underwater sea creature can be made into a keychain or as a realistic stuffed animal toy for children to play with.  it is great as a birthday gift, christmas or holiday gift, or as craft fair products.  girls and boys alike will love these unisex and gender neutral stuffies!  make it in your recipient’s favorite colors, or turn it into a colorful rainbow fish.
this 13-page pdf pattern includes detailed written instructions and 55+ step-by-step progress photos to guide you through the doll making process. 

**size**
length: 3.5” (9cm) 
(note: size varies depending on yarn weight and hook size used. this measurement is based on materials list.)
 
**materials**
fingering/sock (weight #1) yarn in desired colors (i used hobbii friends cotton 8/4)
6mm plastic safety eyes (x2)
2.25mm crochet hook
stuffing
scissors 

note on materials: this versatile pattern can be worked with different yarn weights. remember to use a hook size appropriate to the yarn weight to crochet tight stitches without gaps.

**level**
★★★☆☆ intermediate. requires familiarity with stitches used (below), changing colors, and attaching yarn.

**stitches & techniques used (us terminology)**  
fo = fasten off
yo = yarn over
sk = skip
mr = magic ring
ch = chain
st = stitch
sl st = slip stitch
sc = single crochet
inc = increase (insert 2 sc in same st)
dec = decrease (sc 2 sts together)
hdc = half double crochet
dc = double crochet
blo = back loops only
ds = drop stitch (sc into the round below)
puff stitch
